00:00:01:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:01:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:01:170000.Dialogue: Buona sera, Luigi's Pizza. Buona sera. It means good evening in Italian. May I say, having to explain that to you calls into question the authenticity of your ristorante?

00:00:15:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:15:180000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:17:150000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:17:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:17:150000.Dialogue: Un momento. Oh, for heaven's sake. Now you're being deliberately stupid. Where are you going?

00:00:25:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:25:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:25:050000.Dialogue: I'm having dinner with Priya at Raj's. I think Howard's going to be there. You want to join us?

00:00:28:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:28:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:28:170000.Dialogue: But tonight's Thursday. On Thursdays, everybody comes over here and has pizza. Or a reasonable facsimile prepared by someone claiming to be Luigi, but who sounds suspiciously like Jackie Chan.

00:00:39:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:39:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:39:210000.Dialogue: Can't we make a one-time exception for tonight?

00:00:43:020000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:43:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:43:020000.Dialogue: We could. We could also stop using the letter "M," but I think that idea is isguided and oronic.

00:00:50:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:50:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:50:210000.Dialogue: Just come with me to Raj's.

00:00:52:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:52:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:52:110000.Dialogue: Well, I don't want to go to a party.

00:00:54:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:54:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:54:200000.Dialogue: It's not a party. It's the same group of people who hang out here hanging out over there.

00:00:58:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:00:58:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:58:130000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, but five people eating and chatting is a party.

00:01:02:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:02:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:02:030000.Dialogue: How come it's not a party when we do it here?

00:01:04:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:04:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:01:06:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:06:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:06:130000.Dialogue: I don't know what to tell you, Sheldon. I'm going to see Priya. Everyone's over there. You coming or not?

00:01:11:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:11:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:11:120000.Dialogue: Well, no, sir, and do you know why? In a word: tradition. Every Thursday night for the last eight years, you and I and our friends have gathered here in this very spot to break bread covered with cheese and sauce, discuss the issues of the day, and yes, share a laugh or two.

00:01:31:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:31:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:31:130000.Dialogue: But I guess our rich heritage means nothing to you.

00:01:34:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:34:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:34:080000.Dialogue: I guess you're right. - See you later.

00:01:35:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:35:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:35:130000.Dialogue: - Wait! Leonard! Wait! What am I going to do for dinner?

00:01:40:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:40:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:40:130000.Dialogue: Come with me to Raj's and eat there.

00:01:42:160000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:42:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:42:160000.Dialogue: I can't do that. What if he serves haggis and blood pudding?

00:01:47:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:47:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:47:040000.Dialogue: I really doubt that's what he'll serve.

00:01:50:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:01:50:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:50:230000.Dialogue: But what if he does? I'll be obliged to dine on liver and lungs stuffed in a sheep's stomach. And frankly, blood pudding is essentially the same thing. I don't know why he's serving both.

00:02:01:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:02:01:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:01:080000.Dialogue: What do you want to do? You want to come with me, or do you want to sit here alone?

00:02:05:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:02:05:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:05:070000.Dialogue: No, I'll go to your haggis party. But I'm telling you. This is adness. This is utter and complete adness. - Oh, dear!D63

00:02:38:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:02:38:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:39:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:02:39:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:39:220000.Dialogue: Raj's television. I just realized we're about to spend an evening watching a plasma screen with a cluster of dead pixels in the upper left-hand corner.

00:02:48:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:02:48:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:48:110000.Dialogue: So don't watch TV. Read a book.

00:02:51:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:02:51:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:51:070000.Dialogue: And be a social pariah? Oh, you know that's not my style.

00:02:54:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:02:54:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:59:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:02:59:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:59:040000.Dialogue: The audible sigh is a show of exasperation, right?

00:03:02:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:02:180000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:03:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:03:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:03:230000.Dialogue: Is it about me or the dead pixels?

00:03:08:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:08:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:08:030000.Dialogue: Hey, you're just in time. We made Tex-Mex.

00:03:10:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:10:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:12:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:12:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:12:040000.Dialogue: Oh, Indians making Tex-Mex. Might as well have had the Chinese pizza.

00:03:18:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:18:030000.Speaker: Priya

00:03:19:090000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:19:090000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:21:150000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:21:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:21:150000.Dialogue: That's got to be fun for you, huh?

00:03:25:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:25:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:25:110000.Dialogue: Watching Hofstadter suck the saliva out of your sister's mouth?

00:03:30:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:30:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:30:130000.Dialogue: Excuse me. Before this evening goes any further, we need to decide where everyone is going to sit.

00:03:36:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:36:050000.Speaker: Priya
00:03:36:050000.Dialogue: There is no assigned seats, Sheldon. Just sit anywhere. Make yourself comfortable.

00:03:40:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:40:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:40:010000.Dialogue: Oh, what fun. We're like hippies at a love-in.

00:03:44:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:44:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:46:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:46:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:03:51:000000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:51:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:51:000000.Dialogue: Oh, look. it's Harry Potter and 98% of The Sorcerer's Stone.

00:03:57:150000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:03:57:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:57:150000.Dialogue: Okay, we've got fajitas with all the fixins, so you make your own.

00:04:03:100000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:04:03:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:04:07:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:04:07:230000.Speaker: Priya
00:04:07:230000.Dialogue: Do you want a margarita, Sheldon?

00:04:10:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
00:04:10:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:10:030000.Dialogue: A margarita?! Where are we?! What is happening?!

00:04:14:230000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:04:14:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:14:230000.Dialogue: Oh. Hey, Sheldon. What can I get you?

00:04:18:140000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:04:18:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:18:140000.Dialogue: Water. Neat. With a little umbrella.

00:04:22:230000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:04:22:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:24:180000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:04:24:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:24:180000.Dialogue: Sadly, Penny, this evening, I am the Dark Knight, roaming these mean streets alone. A windbreaker for my cape, and a stern expression for my cowl.

00:04:37:120000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:04:37:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:39:180000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:04:39:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:39:180000.Dialogue: Excuse me? Isn't this the point where the world-weary barkeep absentmindedly wipes down the bar and coaxes the woes out of the troubled patron?

00:04:49:160000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:04:49:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:49:160000.Dialogue: Well, I was getting your stupid umbrella, but all right.

00:04:56:050000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:04:56:050000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:00:100000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:00:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:00:100000.Dialogue: I don't think your heart's in it, but since you asked... Apparently, because Leonard is dating Raj's sister, we're all forced to hang out at his apartment.

00:05:09:090000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:09:090000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:11:230000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:11:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:11:230000.Dialogue: Indeed. Yeah, at one point, Raj put on reggae music, and his sister took off her shoes. It was like the last days of Caligula.

00:05:24:180000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:24:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:24:180000.Dialogue: Oh, I have to get this. Umbrella?

00:05:29:140000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:29:140000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:31:070000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:31:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:31:070000.Dialogue: Wonder what she's exasperated about. Hello?

00:05:35:120000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:35:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:05:35:120000.Dialogue: Sheldon, are you all right? When last we spoke, you were going to take a taxi home from Raj's, but according to Facebook, you just checked in at the Cheesecake Factory.

00:05:43:140000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:43:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:43:140000.Dialogue: Yes, I was in a taxi, but the driver didn't look at all like the photograph on his license, so I leapt out and ran for it.

00:05:51:140000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:51:140000.Speaker: Amy

00:05:52:230000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:52:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:52:230000.Dialogue: There you go. Just like recovering alcoholics drink in the Caribbean.

00:05:57:070000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:57:070000.Speaker: Amy

00:05:59:050000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:05:59:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:59:050000.Dialogue: Oh. Hi, Amy. How you been?

00:06:02:020000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:02:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:02:020000.Dialogue: Fine. From this angle, I can see up your nose.

00:06:06:140000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:06:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:06:140000.Dialogue: Yeah, it's a great time to be alive, isn't it?

00:06:09:070000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:09:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:09:070000.Dialogue: Don't worry. My problems can wait while you two hens finish your clucking.

00:06:14:070000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:14:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:14:070000.Dialogue: Look, Sheldon, Leonard is dating Priya. She is staying with Raj. That means you're all probably gonna be hanging out there more.

00:06:20:130000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:20:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:20:130000.Dialogue: Penny, I'm sorry you got dragged into this. I know you're devastated that your ex-boyfriend has found an exciting new lover with flawless, caramel-colored skin.

00:06:29:050000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:29:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:29:050000.Dialogue: Okay, I'm not upset about Leonard and Priya.

00:06:32:100000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:32:100000.Speaker: Amy

00:06:36:070000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:36:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:39:070000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:39:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:39:070000.Dialogue: Sheldon, look at me. I think it's time to face the fact that Leonard is the nucleus of your social group. Where he goes, the group goes.

00:06:46:220000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:46:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:46:220000.Dialogue: Leonard the nucleus? That makes no sense. I'm the whimsical elf that everyone looks to for a good time.

00:06:55:100000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:06:55:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:55:100000.Dialogue: I'm not saying that you're not fun. You're the most fun person I know.

00:07:01:010000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:07:01:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:01:010000.Dialogue: A lot of people think I'm fun to be around.

00:07:03:170000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:07:03:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:03:170000.Dialogue: Don't be needy, bestie. That's probably part of what chased Leonard away.

00:07:09:190000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:07:09:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:09:190000.Dialogue: What I am saying, Sheldon, is that your group is Leonard-centric. If it were a town, it would be Leonardville. If it were an Islamic nation, Leonardstan. If it were the birthplace of motion pictures, we'd all be singing "Hooray for Leonardwood."

00:07:23:160000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:07:23:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:23:160000.Dialogue: Ooh, I got one. If you guys were a band, you'd be called Leonard and the Leonards.

00:07:30:170000.Scene: The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
00:07:30:170000.Speaker: Amy

00:07:40:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:40:120000.Dialogue: You do realize everyone's eating at Raj's again tonight.

00:07:42:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:42:230000.Dialogue: I didn't say the snacks were for you now, did I, Nosy Rosie?

00:07:53:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:53:080000.Dialogue: Yes. Must be killing you wondering who. Fine, I'll tell you.

00:07:58:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:58:130000.Dialogue: Stuart from the comic bookstore, Barry Kripke from the university, Penny's ex-boyfriend Zack and TV's LeVar Burton.

00:08:14:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:14:080000.Dialogue: Okay, well, tell him I loved him on Star Trek.

00:08:17:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:17:040000.Dialogue: Please, Leonard, stop trying to horn in on my new friends.

00:08:25:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:25:130000.Dialogue: We had a good run, you and I.

00:08:33:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:33:120000.Dialogue: But change is a part of life.

00:08:37:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:37:110000.Dialogue: Okay. I have guests coming. I'm afraid I'm going to have to ask you to leave now.

00:08:48:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:48:080000.Dialogue: Don't make this harder than it is, Leonard.

00:09:02:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:02:080000.Dialogue: Of course I'll be back. I live here!

00:09:21:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:21:060000.Dialogue: Well, it would appear LeVar Burton won't be joining us. Let's get started. I thought we'd begin by going around the room, introducing ourselves and saying a little bit about why we're here. Okay. I'm Sheldon. Uh, for regular readers of The New England Journal of High Energy Physics, I need no introduction. If you're not familiar with that publication, there's a free copy in your goody bag.

00:09:50:050000.Speaker: Stuart
00:09:50:050000.Dialogue: Um... Hi. I'm Stuart. I run a comic bookstore, which for financial reasons, I'm currently living in. And I guess what I'm hoping for most out of tonight is a hot shower.

00:10:08:090000.Speaker: Zack
00:10:08:090000.Dialogue: I'm Zack, and I'm, uh... Uh...

00:10:15:020000.Speaker: Zack
00:10:15:020000.Dialogue: Could you come back to me?

00:10:20:170000.Speaker: Barry
00:10:20:170000.Dialogue: I'm Barry Kwipke, and I'm here because you told me there was going to be a whaffle.

00:10:28:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:28:020000.Dialogue: Patience, patience, Barry. The whaffle... The raffle is the grand finale to an evening-long festival of fun and folly.

00:10:42:100000.Speaker: Zack
00:10:42:100000.Dialogue: Okay, I'm ready. I'm Zach, and I'm, uh... Oh, crap, why is this so hard?

00:10:57:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:57:020000.Dialogue: We're here to kidnap you for a girls' night out.

00:10:59:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:10:59:230000.Dialogue: the term "kidnap" is being used playfully.

00:11:05:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:05:200000.Dialogue: Good. Now put this pillowcase over your head.

00:11:10:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:10:160000.Dialogue: She used to be much more fun, until Leonard punched her in the heart.

00:11:16:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:11:16:170000.Dialogue: We just thought you might want to go out and have a good time, maybe go dancing.

00:11:20:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:20:140000.Dialogue: Oh. Gee, thanks, but I'm not really in the mood.

00:11:23:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:23:030000.Dialogue: You do understand that it will distract you from obsessing over the rich variety of sweet loving that your ex-boyfriend is currently receiving from the fiery jewel of Mumbai.

00:11:31:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:31:110000.Dialogue: Okay, look, if I agree to go out with you guys, will you promise to stop pestering me about Leonard and Priya?

00:11:39:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:39:200000.Dialogue: All right. I'll go change. Come on in.

00:11:41:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:41:100000.Dialogue: If you'd have let me bring the chloroform, we wouldn't have had to put up with all this jibber-jabber.

00:11:49:170000.Speaker: Zack
00:11:49:170000.Dialogue: Anyway, after we get done snowboarding, I go back to the lodge and get in the Jacuzzi. There's no one around, so naturally, I'm free-balling it. Next thing I know, this beautiful chick shows up, drunk out of her skull, wants to get in with me.

00:12:03:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:03:050000.Dialogue: Question. Was it a Jacuzzi or a hot tub?

00:12:11:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:11:230000.Dialogue: Jacuzzi is a commercial brand. Hot tub is the generic term. I.E., all Jacuzzis are hot tubs, but not all hot tubs are Jacuzzis.

00:12:20:220000.Speaker: Zack
00:12:20:220000.Dialogue: Is that like all thumbs are fingers, but not all fingers are thumbs?

00:12:28:220000.Speaker: Zack
00:12:28:220000.Dialogue: Nice. Now, what exactly are toes?

00:12:35:210000.Speaker: Stuart
00:12:35:210000.Dialogue: Can you please get back to the drunk girl? I'd like something to think about in the shower.

00:12:40:220000.Speaker: Zack
00:12:40:220000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah. Right. Anyway, she takes off all of her clothes, climbs into the hot tub, and the first thing I notice...

00:12:51:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:51:180000.Dialogue: Of course it did. It's said that Archimedes, the ancient Greek mathematician, discovered the principle of displacement while taking a bath.

00:13:00:080000.Speaker: Berry
00:13:00:080000.Dialogue: Terrific. Go ahead, Zack. Naked drunk girl, free-balling, continue.

00:13:04:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:04:040000.Dialogue: Forgive me, but I think you'll find my story is more interesting.

00:13:08:000000.Speaker: Berry
00:13:08:000000.Dialogue: Does yours have wet breasts in it?

00:13:10:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:10:140000.Dialogue: Better. It has a gold crown. You see, the king wondered how much gold was in it and charged Archimedes with coming up with the solution. Because the crown was irregularly shaped, there was no way to mathematically determine its volume. But, while bathing, Archimedes realized he could immerse the crown and measure the amount the water rose.

00:13:34:070000.Speaker: Zack
00:13:34:070000.Dialogue: So, long story short, I nailed her.

00:13:52:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:52:140000.Dialogue: All right, that concludes the "getting to know you" portion of the evening. Who's ready to play some vintage video games? And tonight's selections include ColecoVision's "Smurf Rescue in Gargamel's Castle," Atari's "Cookie Monster Munch," and for you text adventure aficionados, Zork. Pick me, pick me. I'm fun.

00:14:16:230000.Speaker: Berry
00:14:16:230000.Dialogue: That all sucks the big hairy meatball. How about I go get the karaoke machine out of my car, get plastered and blow the roof off this place?

00:14:26:050000.Speaker: Zack
00:14:26:050000.Dialogue: Great, I'll make a beer run.

00:14:27:130000.Speaker: Stuart
00:14:27:130000.Dialogue: And I'll take a shower. We'll meet back here in 15.

00:14:39:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:39:180000.Dialogue: This is delicious. Where'd you learn to make chili?

00:14:42:150000.Speaker: Priya
00:14:42:150000.Dialogue: When I was at university in England, my flatmate was from Texas.

00:14:46:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:46:080000.Dialogue: I hope she wasn't anything like my flatmate from Texas.

00:14:49:230000.Speaker: Priya
00:14:49:230000.Dialogue: Sheldon is a bit quirky, isn't he?

00:14:52:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:52:110000.Dialogue: Oh, please. That crazy bastard's looking at quirky in the rearview mirror.

00:15:00:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:00:010000.Dialogue: Did you know that, per our roommate agreement, I have to wash my feet before I get in the shower? And not in the sink. We each have special buckets.

00:15:08:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:08:180000.Dialogue: Raj, did you ever tell your sister about the time Sheldon got punched by Bill Gates?

00:15:26:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:26:130000.Dialogue: Bam. Right in the nose. Made me proud to own a PC.

00:15:32:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:32:020000.Dialogue: I'd like to propose a toast to a rare and wonderful Sheldon-free evening.

00:15:45:150000.Speaker: Priya
00:15:45:150000.Dialogue: Why is it called a toast?

00:15:47:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:47:200000.Dialogue: Oh, the ancient Romans put spiced toast in their punch bowls.

00:16:07:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:07:010000.Dialogue: So, where do you guys want to go dancing?

00:16:08:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:08:220000.Dialogue: We were hoping you'd know a place.

00:16:10:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:10:160000.Dialogue: Yes, perhaps somewhere packed tightly with young, beautiful bodies sweating and writhing against each other in a glorious orgy of the flesh.

00:16:18:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:18:210000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah, I know that place.

00:16:23:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:23:150000.Dialogue: That should display enough of your bosom to attract a new mate, or a hungry infant.

00:16:28:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:28:080000.Dialogue: Okay, let's go through this one more time. Just because Leonard has a new girlfriend does not mean I need to go out and hook up with some guy.

00:16:35:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:35:210000.Dialogue: But you could if you wanted to, right?

00:16:39:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:39:050000.Dialogue: Pick out the hottest guy in the room, take him home, do unspeakable things to him, then kick him to the curb with a smile on his face and teeth marks on his heinie?

00:16:54:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:54:130000.Dialogue: I don't know. It's fun while you're doing it. And then after, it's mostly embarrassment, self-loathing and regret.

00:17:02:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:02:020000.Dialogue: I would take that deal all day long.

00:17:06:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:06:110000.Dialogue: Yeah, well, it's not gonna happen tonight. You know, for the first time in my life, I am not in a relationship, and I'm totally okay with it.

00:17:13:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:13:140000.Dialogue: You know, if being on your own is new to you, I'd be happy to share some tension-relieving techniques for ladies I've perfected over the years. For example, do you have an electric toothbrush?

00:17:33:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:33:020000.Dialogue: It appears to be something preserved between two pieces of acrylic.

00:17:37:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:37:150000.Dialogue: Oh, it's a snowflake from the North Pole. Leonard gave it to me last year.

00:17:41:030000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:41:030000.Dialogue: Oh, God, that is so romantic.

00:17:45:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:17:45:210000.Dialogue: Leonard's really one of a kind.

00:17:48:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:48:070000.Dialogue: Saying that while holding a snowflake is a bit heavy-handed, don't you think?

00:17:52:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:52:070000.Dialogue: Let me see that. Oh, screw it. I can deal with a little self-loathing. Let's go find me a heinie to bite.

00:18:02:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:02:150000.Dialogue: Outstanding. And if we fail, we can always stop at CVS and pick you out a nice toothbrush. I call mine "Gerard."

00:18:38:080000.Scene: The apartment. Barry and Zack are singing “Don’t Go Breaking My Heart”
00:18:38:080000.Speaker: Stuart

00:18:49:070000.Speaker: Priya
00:18:49:070000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, Sheldon bought a loom and learned how to weave?

00:18:53:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:53:150000.Dialogue: He actually got pretty good. He made us all matching serapes.

00:18:57:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:57:140000.Dialogue: I still wear mine when there's a nip in the air.

00:19:00:170000.Speaker: Priya
00:19:00:170000.Dialogue: Now, was this before or after he adopted the 25 cats?

00:19:04:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:04:200000.Dialogue: Long before the cats. I think it was around the time he tried to declare our apartment a sovereign nation. I still have some of the currency.

00:19:14:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:14:220000.Dialogue: All my friends. All my friends. All my friends.

00:19:21:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:21:070000.Dialogue: I think it's like Beetlejuice. We said his name too many times.

00:19:30:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:30:170000.Dialogue: Hey. I thought you were with your new buddies.

00:19:33:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:33:020000.Dialogue: I had to leave. They were having fun wrong.

00:19:36:190000.Speaker: Priya
00:19:36:190000.Dialogue: Come here, Sheldon. Sit here with me.

00:19:40:100000.Speaker: Priya
00:19:40:100000.Dialogue: Would you like some homemade chili?

00:19:47:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:47:100000.Dialogue: Then it's not chili. Real chili has no beans in it, but you're from a foreign land, so your ignorance is forgiven.

00:19:54:210000.Speaker: Priya
00:19:54:210000.Dialogue: Sheldon, do you want some or not?

00:19:57:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:57:220000.Dialogue: Yes, please. Your girlfriend's a little short-tempered.

00:20:04:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:20:04:100000.Dialogue: I'd like to propose a toast to friends, no matter how quirky.

00:20:11:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:11:190000.Dialogue: Priya, do you know why this is called a toast?

00:20:15:180000.Speaker: Priya
00:20:15:180000.Dialogue: Actually, I do. I believe the Romans used to put spiced toast in their punch bowls.

00:20:21:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:21:150000.Dialogue: She's also a bit of a know-it-all.

00:20:26:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:26:130000.Dialogue: Mmm. This is good. Whatever it is.

00:20:45:230000.Scene: The apartment. Stuart is singing “Walking on Sunshine”. Barry and Zack are doing backing vocals.
00:20:45:230000.Speaker: LeVar Burton
00:20:45:230000.Dialogue: Hello? I... Oh, I don't think so. I am so done with Twitter.
